headline: Ohio lawmaker introduces legislation that would require a photo ID to vote
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences:
Voters who choose to vote by mail would be required to provide both of the following:
Driver’s License/State ID number, or a photocopy of their Driver’s License/State ID
The last four digits of their social security number
The bill also provides every Ohio citizen 17 years or older the opportunity to receive a free state ID.

“I want to ensure we have the most accurate and trusted elections in the country, and requiring a photo ID to vote is a simple measure we can take to achieve that goal.”
Under Senate Bill 320, Ohioans would be required to show a photo ID when voting in person.
"One of my priorities in the legislature has always been to improve election integrity and voter confidence in Ohio,” Gavarone said in a statement.
She previously introduced Senate Bill 52 in 2019, which was signed into law, that required audits for local, state and federal elections in Ohio.
State Sen. Theresa Gavarone (R-Huron) introduced Senate Bill 320 on Wednesday she says aims to improve election integrity and security in Ohio.

COLUMBUS, Ohio —
An Ohio lawmaker is introducing legislation that would require a photo ID to vote in Ohio’s elections.
Senate Bill 320 will be referred to a committee for further consideration.
